Listening to Blackbird by the Beatles while in grade 9 summer school. THe music was playing loud so everyone could hear. The person behind me asked my to turn down the music.  Older man got angry at me for crossing the street. I had right of way however so it was really him at fault.
The situation of failing to hand in the assignment on time

The most frequent recollection that has recurrently popped into my mind by itself throughout the most recent year is one where I made a bad decision. I gave someone advice that they took the wrong way, and did not carry out as I intended. As a result, things did not go well and I got the blame.
A discussion I had with a family member about a few issues they were going through.
losing my brother at the mall in the states

It is a memory from when I was somewhere between kindergarten and grade 2. I can remember what house I lived in but not my exact age. It is a memory of sexual abuse I prefer not to describe. The details of the event are vivid and frequently pop into my mind but everything else from that time period is not.
When I moved a couple years ago and went to live with my aunt and uncle

I woke up, and I realized I made a huge mistake when I left my best friend. This was a result of severe depression, and it has permanently scarred me for the past year. I have been unable to forgive myself for what I did.
recollection from when i was 9. it was a fight between my parents.
It was three years ago and my then boyfriend made a comment that he shouldn't have. I got extremely hurt and upset. I behaved very differently in the three days to follow, very closed off and silent.

The most recent would be thinking back to elementary where I didn't know how to interact with girls, and I would unintentionally do things that others would perceive as creepy when around my first crush. One time I was caught staring at her while I was dozing off but then quickly look away when our eyes met. However, there were multiple similar awkward situations that occurred in a similar fashion due to my lack of experience with interacting with girls after puberty struck.

A few months ago I learned that my boyfriend of 2 years cheated on me (while intoxicated, but still no excuse) on vacation a few months ago. I can't bring myself to leave him. Every few hours the visual of him sleeping with someone else pops into my mind and I feel like I can no longer go on. It just keeps happening, and I keep seeing it. I see the look on his face the first time I saw him after what happened. How someone I loved so much went from being one of the most important people in my existence to the person who single-handedly ruined everything I loved about my life. I wish it would stop.

The memory was of a night where I was hanging out with friends. The only reason it was reoccurring was that something happened that embarrassed me so I thought about that situation a couple of times after that day.
two friends fighting, I didn't want to get involved ended in them saying mean stuff toe eachother and one driving away. Now they both won't talk to me even though I did nothing.
The way I act toward or around a person I'm interested in.

When my mother was very ill with stage 4 cancer and our family was constantly in and out of the hospital monitoring her condition and were there for support. From time to time I experience those vivid memories return to my thoughts without any effort. Memories of our family crowded around her hospital bed, the nurses, doctors and surgeons giving us information hourly and the way the illness progressed and its affects on our family.
My roommate has gotten into a car accident which I was a witness too.  I have had a falling out with my friends and the conversation was really hard for me to deal with.

I was at a different university before and the events from my last term and first term here at Uwaterloo often comes pop up. I would remember  social interactions that are awkward or things I did somewhat very foolishly. Sometimes, it will be reminded by location related such as in the class, while applying for jobs.

I can remember some events happened when I was 3 years old. For example, I watched a woman trapped under a bicycle and she was also watching me, or starting at me... I quickly passed by. Also, when I was reading articles or books, some sentence can make me remember some sentences the others told me several years ago, even though those sentences did not make any sense to me at those years.

When the season gets changed from winter to spring, I remember the day when I attended my dad's funeral. When I feel the breeze or smell rain in the cold air, I all of a sudden remember the moment when I walked into the hospital. Then, I tend to get sad or think about other things that was happening at the same time.

The event was an interview that I participated in during high school for a club executive position. The interview went very badly and it ended with me singing a song as I walked out of the room. It was very uncomfortable, and I remember feeling really embarrassed and judged by the interviewers.
Cutting my father and step-mother out of my life along with all associated family when I was in middle school
Breakup with my boyfriend of 12 months

I'm in grade 3 and we're playing a game where you need to act something out without speaking. It's my turn and the very first thing I do is try to explain what I'm doing with words. I am corrected by the teacher and I sit back down.
Embarrassing memory when I said something "wrong". The person didn't respond negatively, but they didn't respond positively either. This happened when I was 9?

My mom shouted at me in front of the family, because I cried for not being allowed to do something. I wanted to go out with my aunt, but she had to stay home to take care of her baby. I did not understand why anyone else could not replace her such as my grandma.
When I am not pre-occupied with things, sometimes my thoughts inevitably wander to my past relationships I have had and analyze what went wrong with the relationships.
Doing something very stupid that make a girl hate me/ Stupid thing said and done/ Nightmares

Took a carpool home from Waterloo. Although I discussed the drop-off point with the driver, she asked me when we were close to the exit, which exit to take. I am unexperienced in driving and told her the wrong exit. We ended up having to use google maps and the ride took 20 minutes longer.
I don't remember, I think about a lot of things that have happened a lot.
One night I was very drunk and vomited in the backseat of a taxi. The driver was very angry and started yelling at me. I paid him about $700 to help cover the cost of cleaning it.
Thoughts of my first semester and how lonely and stressed out I was. I was in a bad place first semester. It is memories all around campus.

no pure extended memory is able to be withdrawn but multiple short visual memories have appeared. things from sitting in a room as a child sorting hockey cards on a carpet while listening to a hockey game or flashes of moments in where I had picked up a box to move it to another room.

I hope what happened this morning count as a recollection of a memory.  My card didn't work on the bus even though I already paid my tuition fees so I had to get off the bus since the bus driver was kind of strict on his own policies. The guy was doing his job, but I feel like he can give me the benefit of a doubt. I ran all the way to class only to be late a few minutes.
Remembering how I felt in a certain stressful moment. Comes into thought randomly, can be by myself or talking with others. Seems to not be triggered by anything in particular.
A negative relationship from the past occasionally comes up. It would be events occurring during the beginning and how it progressed onward.
It is a fierce argument I had with my aunt two years back

The time my father drove an hour to my dorm to yell at me for loosing my phone and not contacting him first. I lost it the day before and spent the entire day looking for it before deciding to tell him, which apparently wasn't the right approach. He was livid, and made many criticisms about who I was.
My grandfather collapsing while we were on vacation and him then being diagnosed with cancer

The events that most frequently come up are bad memories from my childhood. These events are from 10-15 years ago and oftenr come into my mind and are hard to get rid of. I think I remember things pretty well, but it seems that my memory is mostly of the context around the event and a few specific moments inside a longer time period. These events are usually with people i am close with, friends and family although also often include people who were a part of my life for shorter amoutns of time.

I was perched behind my mom after she had picked me up after kindergarten. I was perched behind her on the chair playing with her hair. Out of annoyance, she swung her arm back and not knowing I was standing on the arm rests, knocked me off the chair. She apologized but had to return to work, telling me to play elsewhere.
It was an event, where I did and said some things than when the memory re-occurred it got me really embarrassed and reflecting on how I could have performed those actions
it involves memories of alcoholism and broken memories of drinking binges.  These memories will simply 'pop' into my mind - sometimes vivid, sometimes not.
misunderstanding a question in an interview, answering based off of my interpretation, realizing it was wrong, feeling pretty embarrassed

In the memory, I felt very hopeless, weak, and powerless. It felt as if my life was being taken away but I'm still alive to see all of it. The memory felt like nothing but death, when I thought of it, I would rather physically die (due to the emotional and psychological stress and pain that it was causing me).
Relationship related memories Trips / family moments
Memories that my feeling got hurt, trauma
How I was back in middle school. I was very shy and insecure, and I was reflecting on how much I've come from that time.

I remembered a traumatic event that was related to a person that I knew violently disappear from my life. I just felt disconnected and far away from my problems, and it made me extremely vulnerable and physically unwell.

The times I said something stupid. Like when I was talking to a friend and I said the first thing that popped into my head. The memory would come back to me and I would feel like they would never talk to me the same way again because I am an idiot.

When i hooked up with this guy who was my friend and then afterwards he started ghosting me and i was like forget the other stuff lets just be friends and he was still being a dick so i went a lil crazy on him (just a lil) and he thinks im a lil crazy now

There was a miscommunication between myself and someone else in which I felt they were hurt by it.  While they said that they weren't and I attempted to clarify the situation, I still felt that they were hurt by the initial interaction.  Sometimes I feel guilt over this.

recollection of a major conflict my parents had a few years ago, where one accused the other of cheating. one slept in the basement for a few weeks, the other lashed out at my siblings and i with emotional rage. i questioned everything i knew about love and relationships, and watched the worst parts of my parents' personalities emerge. rage, violence, hate, ignorance. realized my mom might have BPD, i asked my extended family to help me get help and i was shut down.
I went to Korea when I was very young to go to an art school I remember being yelled at by my teacher frequently when a bunch of other students were around.
I don't remember any that is repeated.
i have recurrent collections of my last week of full time work

being prescribed medication for hypothyroidism. I was depressed and ill for a really long time before I found a solution. This had severely affected my performance in school as well, in a negative way.

I was alone at a local community center trying to buy a phone. A pair of two tall black men in hoodies arrived. They struck me with a pistol when I refused to comply.

Driving down a certain road near my family house, there was a cop hidden standing behind a sign holding speed gun and checking the speed the cars were driving. Each time i passed by that street i always look to see if he is there checking my speed in case i am speeding. Its been a long time since the last time I saw him there, but i still look out of habit.
I can't actively recall. I try to suppress any bad memory when it comes up.

it should be when i was trying to have relationship with my first girl friend. I feel shameful about when i talk some love word or write something or date with her. Now we seperated, and the memory of the shame things often flash back to my memory. Honestly, some recurrent memeory recollections mostly are my shame memeory or regretful or happy memeory.

A conversation with someone. I was not involved in the discussion itself, but part of the group listening to what the two other individuals were talking about. Not a particularly emotional or important event. Possible I will never think of it again.

things from the past such as interactions with girls, mistakes ive made, embarrassing moments   usually things we try to forget but never can because of how cringe they are
generally i what pops in my mind is what I hear from other people. And when I see myself in such situation it instantly pops

memories of hanging out with a guy from my past, I remember the experiences I had when I knew him, dreams of hanging out with him, or him ignoring me, regretting everything, questioning why I still think about him. I unno

When I made notes in a geography class, I felt familiar about the movement about taking notes and the context I wrote. This experience is seen like I experienced before.
Honestly, my mind is always active and these kinds of memories pop into my mind randomly quite often. There is no way I could pick one that I think of most often.

My friend told me how to turn off the website blocker on my computer. In trying to forget how to do it (so i could be more productive), I in fact just kept remembering it. Every time I think about memory or forgetting, I remember my friend telling me how to turn off the website blocker.
I just remembered someone saying a phrase again.
It was a childhood memory. Closely linked with my parents and how I feel about it now.

It was a memory from elementary school, and they were memories on a person I admired and respected. I also felt like I could be myself around this person, and I had this memory sometime after being mistreated by others.

I am walking along in an alley, I see somebody in front of there. I did not go that direction, but I know there is a theater group and they are working for a film. I moving away from the crowd. Finally, I stop before an empty house. I can see it is empty throw the window. I want to walk into the house, but I feel somebody want to call me to stop. I don't know who, and also don't know why I have this feeling, but I know somebody wants to call me.   That's all.

The event that recurrently pops into my mind is about my fathers parenting style. During my earliest years that I can remember, he was always supportive and present even during the "small things." He was also strict in some specific instances and at times not very patient (rarely happened).

A highschool friend trying to make me open up/talk more and me ignoring that person.  Failing a term and not dealing with it well. First year of university memories. working out memories family memories, everyday things-fights, laughs, etc.

1) The few moments before I fell off my bike and got a concussion 2) My first kiss 3) *Context: I used to row on the credit river in Mississauga* I sometimes remember rowing across the water with wind blowing through my face
things I regret and sad memories. moreover, happy memories and thing I enjoyed. Also, activities I have done.

I recalled a storybook that was given to me for my birthday. I recall the stories in there about a bear and a sleeping lion. I remember the book being filled with so many stories and it was heavy and large and white. I recall reading the stories by myself and imagining them come to life.

In grades 11 and 12, I competed in a business competition. I went to Toronto for the provincial level and Atlanta and Orlando for the international level. I had a lot of fun with friends and enjoyed exploring the new cities. Felt Alive.

This memory is kind of embarrassing.  It's like I'm reflecting upon a me that only happened at that point in time.  It doesn't quite feel like how I would usually react.  And it's weird to know that other people experienced a different version of myself.
Something upsetting happened and it was all I could think of for a while.

The most frequent recollection that has recurrently popped in my mind by itself would be my first meeting (in a very long time) with a childhood friend of mine where we talked about things happening in our lives and personal circumstances that had happened in the past couple of years. The things we talked about that day come up from time to time whenever we meet up or if I'm reminded by something in our conversation in the situation I'm in. This had all happened within the last year in Winter, where we had a long heart to heart discussion of the things we were going through.
Remembering an event where I crossed paths with someone I had feelings for, said something i perceived as stupid, and left the interaction feeling very embarassed.
not sure

I was hanging out with my friends and we were relaxing in our room. It was nighttime and we were going to bed. My one friend got a cool light off of Amazon and we fell asleep to relaxing sounds and cool lights.
Memory of forming friendship with a person
It was good memories that I had with a specific person. These memories brought happiness in a time where sorrow occurred.  It reminded me of our connection and the purpose of our relationship.

The recollection I had within the last year was a memory from when I was very young, approximately 5 years old. I was at a park near my old house that we used to go to and it was fall and my grandparents were there, who are originally from Poland. I remember going down a slide and feeling really happy.
I would remember my high school life where I have more friends compare to life in university and how I am more disciplined and engaged in high school than in college.

It is leaving my home for a trip to Canada and constantly recollecting my family at the check in counter at the Dubai International Airport bidding me good bye. I remember vividly the expressions, tears and hugs that brought me comfort. I remember the anxiety I had of what to expect when I get back to Canada.

the most recent would be the recollection of memories of the last time I saw my mom on vacation last year  Although, i saw her during christmas my recollection keeps me thinking that the last time was last year in June  its kinda weird
Climbing to the top of an evergreen tree beside my childhood home and tying a ribbon to the highest point I could reach in competition with my younger brother.
Meeting person I met in class and being close friends. Friend is a significant other. Friend hangs out with me.
Being at the house I grew up in back in the Philippines. I often find myself outside the gates looking in. It's around mid-day and it's sunny.

The memory was from orientation week in first year. I remembered meeting someone from juggling club with my friends and we stayed with him and learned to juggle for a couple hours on the V1 green late at night. It was only a couple days in and it was really significant because that night was one where I really bonding with some of my closest friends now.

The most recent recollection that pops up in my mind is a date I had with an ex. It is something I think about when I remember that specific location. It was in the fall to Blue Mountain where we spent an overnight trip. We both had a great time.
Missing an old friend who has not talked to me for a while, our common experience sometimes occurs at my head when I was wondering during a boring lecture.
Sitting on the edge of a cliff, looking out over a forest, and feeling at peace.
The memory is of watching a stand-up comedy special with my younger brother. I remember what jokes were being told, how my brother and I were sitting on the couch, and what we were eating.

Sitting by a lack under a tree relaxing alone as the sky is clear and well lovely. I had a habit of staying at the same place and i think its just when i am at the most peaceful. Also i love lakes in general making it understandable why the sight is a memory that pops in my head constantly.
Times I spent with my dad will randomly pop into my head.  Fun times we had, things I miss about him.
Spending time with my grandmother. Mostly her raising me up from a young age. Examples such as going to the supermarket, park, etc.

Miss the summer when I was living with one of my best friends. Some really trivial and daily stuff about everyday life, just miss the time when I am not alone every day. Also miss the time before university with my family.

Back when I was a kid around the age of 4 or 5 (junior kindergarten) frequent memories of time with my parents and grandma speaking my home language that I do not use frequently anymore. Doing school projects, learning English and playing lego with them.

In grade 10, I went tree planting for a NGO in the suburbs away from any civilization. Then in the morning, I really needed to poop and there were no washrooms nearby. I remember I somehow held it in for the entire day.

As a child going to McDonalds and watching it appear around a bend and disappear as we walk down a winding road. Each time it would disappear my brother would say to my Grandma "where Donalds go?" and then get excited when it would reappear he would get very excited about it. Its not a ver long memory but I just think about it every so often.
Memories from a competitive high school sport where I played well. It felt good to think about my good performances in this sport. It also feels a bit sad that I don't play anymore.
Sometimes I will unexpectedly remember what it was like to hold my ex-boyfriend's hand. I did it often enough, but typically it is either when we were walking or just hanging out together.

I find my memory is quote vivid. I am able to remember the place and time of the event, individuals at the event and what they were wearing. I am able to describe certain areas of the event that were more enjoyable than others.

I am at the park with my mom, dad and brother. I am young, around five, and exploring a particular garden path that has always amazed me. I am looking at how the tree branches surround me in an almost protective armor.
I remembered the time my two friends and I got sushi and I  had one of the best days of my life. I probably get this memory to pop into my mind twice a month at least

I have had recollections of a family trip that occurred almost 12 years ago. During this family trip, my family visited where my grandparents grew up on a very small island. We attended a family wedding and I met many new relatives during the trip.

I keep recollecting my previous relationship and places we went. We had this apartment and everytime I pass by it, I remember memories of him. Particularly, I remember small memories that are fragmented and short and usually happen when I'm walking around campus. I remember him bussing to waterloo when I'm near davis centre.

I remember being in Switzerland in the summer with my best friends. It is warm and beautiful and we were so incredibly happy and free. It was the last time we were going to be together for a long time as it was our grad trip and we were all going to completely different countries for university.

My parents and I went on a day trip outdoors to do hiking/fishing. I remember having a lot of fun and being happy, but right before driving back my parents got into a fight, changing the atmosphere to one of anger and sadness. When we got home, we made up.
Memory with my significant other when I first met him. It is when we were first starting to get to know each other.
memories about memorable childhood events
I went to school in my hometown every day when I was at primary school. I went with my classmate who sitted beside me. We talk about homework and fun things at school.
Winter weekend at the cottage, with my fiance...  roaring fire in the woodstove.  It is night time, lightly snowing and no sounds outside can be heard. The feeling is peaceful and calm.

Memory of my childhood year at preschool and early elementary year have been a constant reflect for the most recent years. My memory is around the carefreeness, happy and wholesome childhood I've had, even from my early years. I was surrounded by a strong family support system and community that all bought into my success.

I remember temperatures and physical sensations specifically. This is all in relation to my emotional state at the time. I this current case it is simply me playing in rough sand in the hot sun at an early age.
just hanging out with friends back in BC
There is a room that appeared to me in a dream that I call the glass room. I enter it and I sit in a lazyboy chair. I dream that dream at least once a week and I thought about it earlier today.
Previous relationships and missed encounters that led to missed opportunities.

I have a memory of my puppy jumping off the couch in which he sprained his leg. I am constantly worried about it happening again, which is why I always think about it. Whenever I see him on the couch, the memory pops into my mind because I am anxious it will happen again.
My mom telling me that she has breast cancer.
My dog passing away.
Being stuck on a narrow mountain and unable to move. Still think of what would have happen if I fell off the mountain.
Memory of awkward interaction between myself and a co-worker. It was during a co-op placement and one of the few times I had interacted with them. I had responded awkwardly to something he had said.
Out with friends and one of them puts out his hand as if to do a high-five. I go for the high-five, but he wasn't actually trying to high-five. I get left hanging and my friends laugh.
an intense fight and argument

The specific memory of my roadtrip in California with a friend from earlier in the year often pops back into my head. Specifically, the drive back up the coast during the final day of the trip is especially vivid. The emotions I felt (sadness due to the trip ending) are vivid, even in my recollection, as are the visuals and the auditory sensations I felt.
no

Spending nights with someone I did not know very well for a few weeks and then having drunk sex with them. It was very embarrassing and I regret it very much. I very often get memories of those times flashing into my head and making me very uncomfortable and irritable.
My recurrent memories are normally associated with one person. Because this person has affected me in a way that was hurtful and where the relationship has turned out in the end.
social interactions

Usually it is some form of mistake or embarrassment that I have gone through, the most common one is in 4th or 5th grade when I hit another kid for no reason. To this day I have no idea why I did this and it still comes up in my mind almost weekly.
I can't recall the recollection, I just remember it happening within the last year.
The death of my father. My mother telling my brother and I. The funeral.
The overall well-being of others and whether I have impacted their safety, well-being, happiness etc. Regretting saying something in fear of offending them.
I have a memory about the funeral services of a close family member who has passed away. I can clearly see everything that I saw on that day, who was there, and the facial expressions of everyone.

it happens so often that it's hard to describe just one. I will randomly remember minuscule details from any time in the past. the most recurring memory that randomly pops up is when i was little and my uncle committed suicide, which i was just told 15 years later, last month. I only remember sitting on a stool in my grandparents family room. nothing else except that stool.
Having to leave a term I put a lot of effort into due to medical reasons
I remember feeling scared. I remember feeling like I had to escape but was to afraid to do so alone. I get frustrated when I think about it.
Being admitted to inpatient care at GRH multiple times for weeks, for the past year. They were all involuntary stays and horrible.

I remember the details of the event, such as who I was with, what we were doing, the things we talked about, etc. I remember how the event made me feel. I remember finer details, such as what we were wearing or certain smells as well.
its like a flash back moment i can picture vividly in my mind. And the same feelings return with it.
There was one time tripped over the stairs in a lecture hall. It was an embarrassing memory and some other students in the class were looking at me and asking me if I was okay.

I remember my crush approaching me while walking to my next class and hitting on me. I didn't understand the situation and brushed her off. I keep having these regrets of not saying how I really felt to her. That event has haunted me for the past year.
Unhappy event that occurred which caused a bunch of stress in my childhood experience.

I recalled a time in high school where I was trying to convince my father to let me go on a school arts trip to England with my best friends. The 'event' occurred every night for over a week, where I'd sit down with my father and mom, as I tried to bring a new argument to the table or make a new agreement each night, and my father would keep saying unecessarily hurtful things to me (I don't deserve to go, I'm not doing enough, I'm not good enough, I should quit my favourite extra-curricular to appease him, etc.). After the talks, I would hide in the bathroom for a few hours and cry, then make up some excuse to my friends about why I probably won't be able to go on the trip.
when my dog got hit by a car
Being anxious, and having to move back from Montreal. The feeling of panic attacks.
In general, I tend to remember particularly anxious and embarrassing situations.

A friend and I had a falling out. This friend was very important to me and left in an (in my opinion) unfair way. Memories of our past and of the events preceding the falling out are the most frequent recollections.

I host games of Dungeons and Dragons with close friends. I tried to pull off a highly choreographed scene as service to one of my players and their character. Due to circumstance and some mistakes it became somewhat anticlimactic and made me feel like I failed the friend.

I was out with friends at a club in town. My boyfriend and I just got back together after taking a break. A friend who I just started speaking to again found out my boyfriend was with another girl during our time apart. He hadn't told me and I found out from my friend and the girl who he was with was there too. I confronted him and he said it was true and I broke down because we had a history with this girl being the root of problems in the past.

Texting my old ex-girlfriend whilst sitting on video chat with her trying to talk her down from self-harm and suicidal thoguhts. Late at night with a lot of stress.  She leaves the chat and the memory becomes mixed with another which were vague texts from her a week later about a similar topic.

Just popped into my head when I was thinking about a different instance where something embarrassing had happened. it makes me panicked, often anxious such memories are of the times in the past when something did not go according to plan which led to anxiety

One memory I frequently have is about an interview that I had a few months ago. It was a very bad interview, and I remember how frustratingly slow my brain turned as I tried to think of a response. I remember the frustration/sadness I experienced while I was answering those last few questions, which were especially challenging. I also remember my emotions when I walked out into the hall after the interview.

I was next to the death bed of a passing elderly family member due to cancer. They were in a coma due to the chemo - I saw very heavy breathing for a while, until there was none. I saw the rest of my family there, and they were in distress. The nurse takes one check with the stethoscope and says "I'm sorry" and hugs my crying mother. I don't remember crying myself. I touch the passing member's forehead - I distinctly remember its texture and warmth.
The memory is personal information given to me. It comes to mind when I am with the person it is about. Also when I'm not doing anything overly exciting, like watching tv or on my phone.

Once when I was 13 I went out for a meal with someone (it was the first time I'd paid for it myself) and I did not tip the waitress because I did not know to. I needed something like $1 in change and expected it to be transactional, but she did not have the change with her and had to go to the back to get my loonie. She rolled her eyes at me and the other person I was eating with gave me a confused and concerned look. Only until I started eating in restaurants more regularly did I realize my mistake, and I have been plagued by the memory ever since, especially in times of stress.

Sitting in a tea house in Belgium in 2017 with some of my closest friends. My one friend was playing the piano while I talked to another about proper wine pairings over tea. It was a sense of calm and quiet that I had never experienced before and haven't since.

Meeting one of my best friends the summer going into grade 1. They moved to our neighbourhood from England and my mom and I brought over a plate of cookies to welcome them. We were both shy and hid behind our moms but we've been great friends since then.

The scenario is pretty vague. My mom is a single mother, and she worked really far away from home. Thus, I lived in my grandparents' house, and my grandparents took care of me.  All the memory about is the moment that my mom came to my grandparents' house to pick me up for some unknown reasons.

Thought of a period of my life when I was in a toxic relationship when I saw the person who I was in a toxic relationship with. I thought about the period where we were not on speaking terms, now we are supposedly fine

baking at christmas time

A fond memory of spending time with someone I used to see alot. Very relaxed and chill environment. I remember the way the room looked and how they did too.

Moments and memories of a past relationship tend to surface. Moments of usually very positive emotion, often vivid in colour and somewhat audible. Often linked to settings only experienced once, with very definitive landmarks.
Riding a tube behind a boat with my girlfriend and her turning to me and telling me how grateful she is to have met me.
Remembering going to a concert (e.g. the artist, the venue, things that happened) or remembering a funny event that happened during the school year with my friends.
I had the memory of school life from the past.  Activities includes, sports day, winter dance, homecoming, etc. I also remember things I did with my friends from the past.
not applicable

a school theatre performance that my group and I worked really hard on in grade 10. A sudden recollection came to me on the performance day, and what we did, the music we played, the direction of the performance.
I was thinking about a deceased family member. I remembered how we had fun together and what we did.

The memory I had was of meeting my first ever university friend. We were at a o-week event and we played at the park together. There was also a water park and we ran through the water together holding hands.

When I was 5 years old I went on a vacation with my family and the maids who cleaned our rooms always left the towels in the shape of animals. Now sometimes when I see towels I think of that the ones that were put out on vacation.
waves crashing onto the shore. sun reflecting off blue water. warm air
Memory of talking to my girlfirends mom. She was good looking very nice, and had a polish accent. We talked about thanksgiving.

I recall being young mabye 3-5 years olds, and playing in the snow with my sister. I have never enjoyed being cold, but my parents made it such a good experience, they made hot choclate and all sorts of unique snow games, this happened right around when I was going into school.

I have a recurrent recollection of particular memories with a past friend with whom i had a romantic attraction but am no longer close with. The memories are mundane but frequent and occur at random throughout the day.

the good times I had with a really good friend that I barely talk to.
Can't remember off the top of my head as there has been countless of them.

The recollections are very vivid and detailed, making me feel as though I am back in that classroom with my friends.
the memory was a pleasant on from my childhood.

it was a memory of when i went to a volleyball camp in serbia. It was more of the feeling that popped into my head than the actual events that took place. It is a funny memory involving something I said to my family when I was younger. It was in a situation where I was supposed to be quiet.

When I was little and at the supermarket with my mom, I wanted to buy a pencil (not from the store, but the area in between the 2 front doors). My mom wouldn't buy it, obviously. Hanging out with my closest friends
childhood memories of my brother and I.
The memory was about a boy I had feelings for but stopped talking to about a year ago. We were hanging out at a restaurant and talking.

the memory that I recalled was of a friend's party that happened last year. it was her birthday party and everyone was really happy. I was the co-host of the event as she is my best friend. I remembered all the fun we had, the games we played, how some people got drunk and all the crazy memories that were created that night.

I remember the times when I went on vacation with my extended family. I recall the memories we had and the activities we did together while on vacation. I recalled my childhood with them and even remembered the jokes that were said together. It makes me miss those times with my family and friends.

The memory takes place in grade 9, when I first met my two best friends. We were walking down a hallway and one went on ahead to drink water from a nearby fountain. When they returned, they seemed to be in a slight panic and was gesturing that a bug was by the fountain. Before I could register the situation, my other friend correctly claimed that there was a fly by the fountain.
My friend face planting at a drive-thru of a Tim Hortons after a Canada's Day party

Random glimpses of past encounters with other individuals occurring at least once a week. 3-4 seconds of clear visual and auditory memory of past events with friends, and family. Remember the childhood time spent with my grandmother.
I had a recollection of a random day I had at home with my family when I was happy. We were all laughing. I remember thinking how I will miss them so much when I am away from them.

My memory involves a new group of friends I made over the summer. It includes the times that we all hung out before school started as we all go to different schools. I remember all the events we went to and all the adventures we had.

I frequently think about how much fun I had at my prom this year. I can still remember getting ready, taking pictures with my friends, eating dinner together, and dancing on the dance floor all night. I can even remember some of the songs that I danced to.
When I was younger my mom would drain the water from pasta over the sink and her glasses fogged up and then she smiles at me
The nerf gun war on the last day of school played by my batch

My memory was leaving my house for the first time, going ahead to University. Since a month has passed by since I left home, I am always surprised believing that a kid like me is currently not living with his parents. This usually happens every year after the day of a month after the first day of school occurs, I always have recollection of me just in absolute awe that I have made it this far in life, and yet I have a long journey to come.
fun weekend with the family, having fun, road trip, relaxing, crazy night
This does not make any sense.
Being in Mexico With my family on a family trip a few years ago

The recollections vary, and there is not one that occurs more than others. Some of them are of the time I have spent with my family in Italy, with past or current boyfriends, or of experiences with my friends. Some are memories that are not particularly pleasant, but occur when I am feeling upset.
graduation

i often recollect being in high school again and sitting in class with my friends back home. Then walking back, doing my same routine and pathway from the bus stop to my house. Going home and laying down on my bed - Feeling comfort and familiarity.

I remember In my second year of high school that my friend wanted these candies, so at break I went to the plaza to buy them, however, I didn't get to see her that break in person, so instead, during class, I told her I could put them in her locker, so she texted me her locker combination, and I went to her locker and put them in.
I was with a group of friends and it consisted of a conversation. The conversation reminded me of a conversation I had with a few other friends back home.
Memory when I was younger around 8 years old, that is not even in this country

My most frequent recollection is of me and my grandmother at our family cottage in Newfoundland. We are walking along the rock beach at the base of our property on the Bay of Islands. She is helping me walk across large rocks that have been made slippery by salt water and kelp growth.

I believe it was yesterday that I had my most frequent recollection. My friend and I had just gotten our WAT cards and he was saying something about his picture and then a memory of another friend taking a photo back in like the 6th to 7th grade popped into my head.
Meeting someone

Remembering a defining moment in my friends life that occurred about 6 years ago. It is the first time he had drank alcohol and every time we are in a social situation with alcohol this recollection comes back to me decently often.

I was young, smiley, and bubbly, as any little girl would be. I was running through the park, going down the slide as my parents smiled and cheered my name while I climbed the monkey bars. However, I slipped and hurt my arm and the other kids ran up to me quickly to ask if I was okay.
i was sitting on my boyfriends truck and looking over the champlain lookout

A memory that comes to mind is about a baseball practice I attended. Part of the team had enjoyed a party the day before, and we ended up running for showing up to practice while showing effects of that party. This memory has reoccured a few times in my head.
THE TIME SPENT WITH MY ENTIRE FAMILY AND FRIENDS BACK IN INDIA
My only memory with my grandfather before he passed away. I was 7 and he was holding my hand and singing to me.

Travelling with my parents on car trips and listening to them for hours talking about their past and imagining them in my head.  This had been right after the death of many of my mother's family members all at once so she was describing her memories of them to me as we drove out to our destinations. I was half paying attention, imagining her story but also starting to drift off in the car.

During my last year of high school, my basket ball team made it to provincials for the first time. I was more of a bench player but was given the opportunity to play in the game that secured us to play at provincials. I played the best I ever had in that game, and felt an incredible amount of pride in my performance.
Memories from sporting events or memories with friends

I would spontaneous;y think of memories of my friends and hanging out with them during our last weeks of high school together. There was no specific trigger as far as I know, but at times, the memories of us going to the mall pop up, and instances from that trip play in my head.

In grade 12 English class, there was a certain person in my class that at the time I wasn't interested in. Later on I became interested and all I could remember was a class we were both in in grade 11. World History class and we were both in the same group for a project. I developed pretty intense feelings for this person and us together in that class in something that popped up very often.
a memory from my childhood with my best friend at the time.
Going on vacation with my family. We went to Europe. It was a great time.

The recollection came when I was in my first lecture at uni. While the professor was speaking, I all of a sudden had a recollection of when I was in gym class in middle school and was amazed at how time went by so fast, as I could not believe that I was already in middle school.

Playing catch with my father, and memories surrounding baseball and my dad. The first game we ever went too, the score of the game, the inning we left, the communication we had. Sitting in the stands and experiencing my first ever game with my brother and my dad, missing my father and thankful for our relationship, his impact on my family and the love of the game he passed onto me.

Playing in a musical competition in the largest contest this instrument has to offer. Winning it was the a true highlight, and quite possibly the biggest achievement I had made at that point in my life, and an achievement that will likely never be accomplished again.
Attending a concert with my brother called Rolling Loud, I imagine us in the crowd then behind the stage. The concert took place in Miami, Florida.

My sister and I are in a car listening to our favourite band. We are on our way to watch this band in concert. We arrive to the concert hall in Toronto and laugh, sing, dance, and cry a little the entire night.

I had had many situations where I felt that situation had happened before or that i was experiencing it a second time. This will occur in the exact moment i recall and that memory will consciously reappear in my head and i make the connect with. Whether it be a memory from a dream or real life it feels like I'm reliving that situation.
sitting crossed legged in a open room. playing games with my friends around me, feeling like its one of the best moments of my life.

In every corner you turned, a festoon of flowers concealed the scrubs of moss. The familiar sound of light-weight shoes hitting hard pavement and the melodic sound of children tittering filled the warm air. The pungent scent of hot iron still lingers on the pads of my fingers as I return from the schoolyard.

the most frequent recollection that has recurrently popped into my mind bye itself within the most recent year is the memory in Grade 12 during my 'Black History Month' performance. I had recollection of me performing in front of my school. I had created multiple dances and hand picked songs for February's 'Black History Month'.

Walking back from a restaurant with a friend that I would like to grow a stronger friendship with. They walked back with me all the way, even when our other friends took different paths, which made me happy because I think it means they want to be my friend, too.

A recollection I experienced was about my dog when she was a puppy. It was about the first time I took her on a walk to a park. It was a warm and breezy summer day and I let her run around the grass. There was a lot of happiness associated with this recollection.
Leaving my house. Biking to a park on my scooter. Sitting on the tire swing. Scooting back to my house and falling down scrapping my knees.
They were all memories from home that occurred when I was in elementary school. One of them was about how my mom fed my brother and me pizza and juice while watching Rescue Heroes on TV on Saturdays.
A good memory with a pet I have had that previously passed away.
My twin brother and I playing basketball together in-front of our elementary school
The memory of me, hanging out with my friends where a there was a really funny scenario.
Having a night picnic on a hillside watching lightning in the distance with a girl I was seeing.
Positive memories of several family vacations throughout my life
Sitting in the living room while my dad served me and my little brother dinner.
concerts

A few days ago I randomly remembered how at some point when I was younger my mom told me this person lived in these houses near this plaza went to. When I was at home I randomly thought it was my therapist that lived there and I was confused because I thought she lived somewhere else. She said it wasn't her but I remembered it was someone from her work. I was surprised I remembered this as it was from so long ago. m
I was having a lot of fun. The weather was amazing and there wasn't a worry in my mind. I never wanted the moment to end!
I went to look at a flower garden before visiting Marine Land with my family when I was a child.  My mother put me on the back of one of the deers which were begging for food.
My Dad and I playing baseball and how he taught me how to throw a baseball properly
Since I am orientation leader, we cheer a lot and this recollection started from starting the cheer and dancing and having a fun time.

I recently recalled a childhoods memory in which me and my siblings were casually dancing and messing around (I seem to be around the age of 4-6 at the time of the memory). We were showing the dance moves to a close family relative.

After recently ending a relationship, I have had several recollections of memories of that relationship. These memories that often pop into my mind include spending Christmas with his family and the happy time of year that it was. The memories revolve around family and joy.
Going to a park as a child

The memory of an old friend that I have not seen in a long time. I was in love with this friend for quite a while and I possibly have not fully moved on. Thus triggering one of my best memories with this individual.
PLAYING AND PERFORMED ON STAGE AT SCHOOL  WITH MY BEST FRIEND IN MY CHILDHOOD.
Hanging out with my old childhood bestfriend Going to her house Playing tag with her dad Me and my sister sleeping over at her house

I remembered a routine a childhood friend of mine and I used to have whenever we spent time at my home. This routine consisted of making this very specific snack (ham and cheese on naan bread, grilled) and sitting at a computer chair and playing these specific computer games. The names I cannot recall but they involved dress-up, operation-type games, etc.
it ususally happens with the kind of perfume. The instant I apply particular perfume, boom, I'm in that exact time and place.

The memory is from a trip that I took to Greece when I was a boy with my father. We were staying on an island in a hotel overlooking a beach. One night at dusk, we walked along a road to a seaside restaurant where we had dinner on an outdoor patio with my cousins. While we were having dinner a fishing boat came in to dock by the restaurant with it's daily haul. I remember the ship's bell ringing, as a cool breeze swept over the patio from the sea where the sun was setting in the distance.

The experience was very exciting, due to the fact that it was something I enjoyed. Since a similar thing happened in the past, I had more experience and knew how to act and what to do. It was a great experience and I would love for it to occur again.
my dad used to sing me lullabies to sleep when I was young. This is not a surprising fact, but I had forgotten about this fact. One day I suddenly remembered it and it made me cry.
Fun times spent with school friends. Quality time spent with family. Cute stuff my dog does.

When I was 5 years old and my uncle died, I was at his nine nights, the night before his burial and I remember seeing a lot of people around me in the courtyard. After leaving the celelbration I asked my mom why there were so many people in the courtyard and she said there weren't any people in the courtyard everyone was inside. My sister and I then came to the conclusion that those people were spirits.
A trip to Toronto Zoo. Spend a whole day there. I had recollections of small details about that trip, the animal I saw, the people I was with.

Falling asleep in my grandparent's house after going grocery shopping. I sat down on the couch by the kitchen and instantly passed out for a few hours. I recall being served wonton after and eating them at the glass dining table in the kitchen with my grandfather in the seat at the head of the table with me beside him to his right.

After a parade, my family was walking back to my car. We saw a sign saying they sold cats. Me and my siblings convinced my parents to get us a cat and they agreed. We were able to take home a cat that day.

I remember myself at a party last year, singing a song typically not too mainstream yet it resonated with the people at the party as they start singing along. Yet, I was not too aware of the people around me when I began singing it, I remember feeling embarrassed and all my friends and I laughing along with others at the party. This happened a good year ago.
Running through a corn maze during fall back home.

traveling to Kenya. I think about it all the time when making decisions and processing my actions toward others and the environment. I think of specific people that I met or activities that we participated in.
I was at dinner at my grandparents house. My grandpa went to shake the ketchup bottle but the lid popped off. Ketchup flew onto the walls and his face.
Overall, the time I used to spent with my family and friends where I was in my hometown.

A childhood memory of me sleeping over at a friend's house for the first time. I tried broccoli for the first time there, as well as got to meet the family bird. Later in the evening, just before going to sleep, I panicked and had my parents pick me up. This memory feels as though it is cut up to only show me these parts of that night.

The memory was of a trip that I recently went on and the people which I came on the trip with me and whom I met during the trip. The happy memories from the trip came into my mind throughout the day. I would also feel emotions that I felt during the trip.

I often find myself remembering events from when I was in high school at random times. Sometimes I think back to certain classes, or specific days that were of significance to me like meeting a new friend.
meet somebody at the mall or something else, i could not remember clearly.

I went to a party with my friends last year for laurier homecoming. It was one of the most funnest nights I have ever had. My friend got upset at us for teasing her and her reaction was very different from what we expected. Still wonder how that happened till this day...
Meeting my current boyfriend for the first time, our first date etc.

Remembering my friends and I went to see a sunrise and then went to this one place for breakfast. We waited until it was open sleeping in the car. Then we were the first one's in and the staff was super nice, afterwards, we went to my friend's place to nap
My first date my boyfriend.
Vacation.
Spending time with my family in Bermuda when I was a child.

Every time I listen to songs from the Sound of Music, memories with my mother pop to my mind. More specifically, watching it with her as a child, as it is something I really enjoyed. At times, I deliberately listen (as I know these memories pop up) to it to take me back to easier times.

The most frequent memory consisted of me and my older sister playing games when we were 6/7 and 9/10. We would often pretend that we were a teacher and a student, sisters in high school, spies, etc. Sometimes we would also use props like a pair of earrings as "coms" or a pointer for a lesson in "class".
playing rugby

My friend and I used to go to after school tuition. There was this one girl who was complaining and it disrupted the whole class and my friend and I could not stop laughing. We both got punished for that.
I met someone on vacation. We hit it off and had sex a few times during that trip. Upon returning home we continued to meet. I often have memories of our time away and particularly of our sex.

In the gates to a ski downhill race. Waiting for the call to go.

A brief recollection I have is going to a nice park with my boyfriend and having a nice walk. This moment consisted of deep talks, loving moments, and quality time. This comes into my mind due to us having such a special time together.

Sometimes memories from high school will return to me without me trying to think about it. They don't necessarily reoccur that much but are usually different fragments of my highschool life, Some of them might be having lunch with friends, going to clubs after school, or just simply chatting in classrooms.
Winning a sporting event. I was walking and I just remembered moments in the game that occurred. It was a positive recollection.
childhood memories with family
not comfortable explaining

One particular memory was about being on vacation with family. We were in a tropical location, although because it was the middle of winter it was actually pretty cold. Occasionally I will remember this experience.
I am laying on my bed in my childhood home.  It is a summer night and the window is open.  The sun hasn't set yet but it is bedtime.  I can hear and smell the summer outside.
Memories of my father buying our first car and taking me with him to buy it. i remember sitting in the back seat watching him talk to the salesman as they closed the deal.
Remember playing soccer with old childhood friends at a local park. The game took place in the night and I was running up the field with the ball.

I can't think of specific memories at the moment that will pop into my head, however, I often find that I go to share a memory with a friend only for them to tell me that I have told them the same story multiple times before. Sometimes they are about things that happened when I was little, or in grade school, or anecdotes that I had wanted to tell someone once and completely forgot about until I remembered later on.

These events tend to be about the same fantasies or "happy" experiences from my last job. I get flashbacks of conversations with attractive coworkers and reflect in different ways. Sometimes I think of things I wish I said or just reenact the scenarios in my head. they tend to be about deep, funny or exciting conversations I had with coworkers.
Sitting in the car in Bahrain. It is night time and it's raining. I'm in the car outside of an apartment.
Memories about past significant events such as birthday parties or memorable moments spent with family and friends.

Time spent with someone that I was very close to but no longer am. The moments and experiences, simple things like revisiting locations and having similar conversations with someone else sparks the memory.

I recalled the events of a night out with friends. We were drinking a lot and I had acted in a bold, loud, and rambunctious manner which is not common for me. The events of the night were overall fun and harmless, and returned to my mind easily, despite the copious amount of alcohol involved.
My first kiss, dates, and times spent with my ex.
I was in a field working out with a friend. It was a sunny day and I was catching my friend and tossing her around.
n/a

My high school graduation—dancing in front of the stage with my friends. The music was too loud and I'd never actually danced at a dance before, but we were all jumping around so I did too. Some people were drunk, but the rest of us were just out there having a good time
It just puts me back into the emotions that I was feeling during the event.
A guy that I really liked and was seeing came into a bar with other girls. He refused to dance with me and didn't want to talk to me. He then proceeded to break up with me in the middle of the bar.

Memory is of an attempt to take down a video from youtube. It was a lecture in a small community setting and organizers agreed that they would not upload any pictures or video recordings. However they uploaded an official video, violating the event. Th ordeal is yet to be resolved.

My friend I am were driving somewhere and were stopped behind a car at a red light. When the light turned green the car in front of us did not move so we drove past them and my friend noticed their face and said they looked like something was wrong. We parked our car and ran back to were we saw the stopped car at the red light. There was someone passed out in the driver's seat with music blaring, their heart beat racing in their throat, and I watched their eyes turn back into their head. We called 911 and watched as they came and dragged him out of his car and onto the ground to preform CPR. After this and before taking him away they told us that he was dead when they first arrived but they were able to bring him back.
usually involves me saying something that I regret or feel embarrassed about.

I have had traumas that have happened to me over the years, so nightmares are common. This was a car accident and an assault that I have struggled with. I have recalled the details of the events like I am reliving it.
parents fighting when I was younger, flashbacks from when I was depressed a few years ago

Memory of my partner and I tent camping at a state park last August in Michigan, US. We were camping just the two of us (our first trip together) and had become slightly intoxicated around the campfire after dinner.This was just after our 1st year anniversary of dating. It was still light outside and we had began to discuss aspects of our relationship together. My partner disclosed that although he had told me he was unsure he wanted to have children in the future, he actually decided he never wanted children. This cut me deeply as I very clearly communicated early on, as early as the third date, and even more so 2-3 months into dating, that not wanting to have children was a deal breaker for me.  That utter helplessness, feeling of betrayal and loss frequently will pop into my mind. My memory is how I felt in that moment, like my relationship was over, anger that he had kept this to himself instead of making this decision earlier on before I was so emotionally involved. I felt I had made sacrifices and changes in my life and plans in order to accommodate our future. I felt like this was an attack on me, saying that he really didn't want to be with me. I felt led on by him as he had casually mentioned "If I had a kid..." in certain situations and had not said anything to me when I discussed future children.

It was a traumatic experience I had when I was 15. My parents were banning me from talking to someone I considered my best friend and mentor. They did so because she was older than me by 8 years and they suspected we were in a relationship. My father threatened to kick me out of the house and my mother became very unresponsive.

Sometimes I remember the time I yelled at my friends at the mall because of they were being mean to me and all i wanted to do was go home. So I yelled at them telling them that my mum was coming to get me and if they didn't come with me they would have to find their own way home.
Seeing a friend talking to someone from down an aisle and when we made eye contact they looked away and ran off.

I was talking to someone I am typically tense around with my partner (at the time) beside me. This individual went to shake my partners hand and I was so nervous about doing the right thing that I intercepted the handshake and shook his hand first. It was very weird and I still think about it to this day.
something inappropriate happened to me. I was scared and frozen. I felt hopeless.

The memory that came to my mind was when my mom told me that she wasn't going to do chemo treatment after she was diagnosed with cancer. I remember exactly how she told me and my reaction - I cried so much. I left the hospital room so she wouldn't see me cry and I felt my world had ended.
Me being with my ex when we broke up. I picture their face and them talking. I picture them leaving me.
I was involved in responding to the suicide of someone I knew. The memory is watching their body exit the building on a stretcher while a paramedic attempted to resuscitate them.

At parties I often feel uncomfortable and judged for being awkward and shy. I often feel myself being quiet and shy around strangers at a gathering and often think about whether or not people like me. The past experience i had was at a stag and doe in which I felt myself trying to avoid talking to stranger but then later thinking about how those people may think I'm mean.

I was doing a presentation in front of a class in the third grade, and I started stumbling on the first few words. I was so stressed about messing up that I had to leave the room to cry. I remember the feeling of standing up at the front and just being so upset I couldn't handle it.
Thinking about my childhood.

Reading an email from a classmate who was angry about the comments I had made on a group project we had done because they thought I was calling them stupid. I just remember the moment super vividly from the point of opening the email, how I physically felt, the blood and panic rushing to my head.
No

My step father passing away. I often recall my mother's reaction and the home atmosphere that transpired. I am often triggered to think of my step father when he was young and healthy by various random things I encounter on a normal basis.
I dont wish to do so.

I was about 9-10 years old, it was Christmas Day and it was well after we had opened presents. My father asked me to construct one of my toys before the day was over, a tent. It was probably some time in the afternoon and I had yet to start construction of the tent and I was playing a new video game that I had received. My father became furious that I had not begun constructing the tent and dragged me to the basement stairs landing. The tent was in the basement.  He then threw me off the landing and I remember landing directly on the cement floor. It was a very loud sort of smack, I landed directly on my shins and forearms. I remember vividly how cold the ground felt and that I didn't move for an extended period of time. I don't remember much after that.

I hosted a housewarming party with a few friends after I bought my first condo.  In preparation I had done alot of cleaning and for some reason had used a strong cleanser in the standup shower. We all made a sound and stepped back.  I was embarrassed for some reason and it stuck with me.

When my sister and I were young there were two kids living at the end of the street that kept following my sister home and teasing her as she walked. One day they decided to play Nicky Nicky 9 doors so they would knock on the door and then run away. My sister and I both told them to leave her alone multiple times but they wouldn't. So, I waited beside the door holding the collar of my extremely friendly golden retriever in one hand and the door knob in another until I heard them knock, when it came I swung the door open and yelled at the kids "Do you want my dog to eat you?" the one kid, terrified, shakes his head. "Then go!" I say and the kids run off. I close the door and laugh with my sister. The kids never messed with her again.
